title: Conservative activist Charlie Kirk in critical condition after being shot at Utah college event
author: The Associated Press
bullets: Charlie Kirk, co-founder of Turning Point USA, was shot at Utah Valley University and is in critical condition.
The suspect in the shooting is in custody, and the incident sparked prayers from former President Trump and others.
The shooting occurred amid rising political violence, including recent attacks on politicians and public figures.

title: Patriots’ defensive coordinator Terrell Williams will be away from team for a few days
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots' defensive coordinator Terrell Williams is taking time away due to a recent health issue, coach Mike Vrabel announces.
Inside linebackers coach Zak Kuhr previously filled in for Williams, but it's unclear who will call defensive plays against the Dolphins.
Vrabel emphasizes that Williams's health is a priority, mentioning the issue developed earlier in the week and requires further tests.

title: 8 unforgettable fall destinations in Vermont, according to Boston.com readers
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Franklin County features the Lamoille and Missisquoi Valley Rail Trails, recommended for biking and hiking in fall.
Scenic Route 100 Byway offers a 146-mile drive through Stowe, Waterbury, and West Dover for autumn foliage.
Stowe, Vermont, known as a leaf peeping destination, is near the Ben & Jerry's Factory in Waterbury.

title: Readers: Are cider doughnuts ever bad?
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Cider doughnuts are a popular fall treat in New England, known for their sweet apple taste and seasonal appeal.
Expert Alex Schwartz advises a perfect cider doughnut should be neither too crispy nor too spongy, with balanced sweetness.
In 2023, Boston.com readers highly recommended cider doughnuts from Bolton Spring Farm, Carver Hill Orchard, and Smolak Farms.

title: Review & setlist: Dua Lipa ramps up the energy, and the electricity, at TD Garden
author: Annie Jonas and Kelly Chan
bullets: Dua Lipa energized fans at TD Garden with her 'Radical Optimism Tour,' featuring new songs from her 2024 album.
The concert included theatrical elements, with themes ranging from oceanic to cosmic, augmented by dancers and visual effects.
Lipa performed a cover of Aerosmith's 'I Don't Want to Miss a Thing' and engaged fans from diverse international backgrounds.

title: How to buy World Cup tickets for Gillette Stadium
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Gillette Stadium will host seven World Cup 2026 games, including group matches, a Round of 32, and one quarterfinal.
Fans must register at FIFA.com/tickets for the Visa Presale Draw ending Sept. 19 or future ticket sales phases.
Single-game tickets start at $60 with premium seats up to $6,730, and hospitality packages start at $11,150.

title: Greg Olsen spoke about getting replaced by Tom Brady
author: Aidan Buchanan
bullets: Greg Olsen expressed frustration over being replaced by Tom Brady as lead color commentator for Fox Sports.
Olsen clarified there was no personal animosity towards Brady and supported his success in broadcasting.
Brady's transition to broadcasting has faced scrutiny after a mixed performance at last year's Super Bowl commentary.

title: Boston police release photos in late-night cellphone thefts investigation
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Boston police released photos to identify suspects involved in late-night cellphone thefts outside city nightclubs and bars.
Suspects allegedly stole passwords and accessed financial accounts using victims' phones taken during rideshares or unsolicited rides.
Incidents occurred in Fenway, Back Bay, Downtown, and Seaport from 11:30 p.m. to 2 a.m. with threats or deception.

title: NBA passes new ‘heave’ rule that Payton Pritchard will love
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: NBA implements rule excluding missed end-of-period heaves from player field-goal percentages starting 2025-26 season.
Heaves are defined as shots from beyond 36 feet taken within three seconds of quarter's end in NBA games.
Celtics guard Payton Pritchard supports the rule, as he believes it will encourage more players to attempt heaves.

title: Watch Matt Damon and Ben Affleck in the first trailer for Netflix’s cop thriller ‘The Rip’
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Matt Damon and Ben Affleck star as Miami cops in Netflix's 'The Rip,' discovering a massive stash of dirty money.
The thriller, directed by Joe Carnahan, is inspired by real events and '70s cop films like 'Serpico' and 'Heat.'
Actors including Steven Yeun and Kyle Chandler join Damon and Affleck in the film, streaming January 16 on Netflix.
